content:
Sure, here are some recipe suggestions that incorporate gluten-free pasta and vegetables and proteins:

1. Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta: Cook gluten-free spaghetti according to package directions. In a pan, sauté garlic and cherry tomatoes until tender. Add in cooked shrimp, baby spinach, and lemon zest for added flavor. Toss with the cooked spaghetti and serve.

2. Zucchini Noodle Pasta with Grilled Chicken: Spiralize zucchini and boil for 2-3 minutes for a low-carb alternative. In a separate pan, grill chicken breasts and chop into bite-sized pieces. Sauté onions and peppers until tender and toss with the zucchini noodles and chicken. Serve with your favorite gluten-free pasta sauce.

3. Mushroom and Spinach Pasta: Cook gluten-free spaghetti according to the package directions. In a pan, sauté sliced mushrooms and chopped spinach. Add in garlic, salt, and pepper to taste. Toss the cooked spaghetti with the mushroom and spinach mixture, and top with Parmesan cheese.

4. Lentil Bolognese: In a pan, cook lentils according to package directions. Sauté onions, carrots, and celery until tender. Add crushed tomatoes and the cooked lentils to the pan, with salt and pepper to taste. Let the sauce simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, and serve over cooked gluten-free spaghetti.

5. Broccoli and Tofu Stir-Fry: Cut tofu into small cubes and sauté in a pan until golden brown. In a separate pan, sauté broccoli florets until slightly tender. Add soy sauce and sesame oil to the broccoli for extra flavor. Toss the cooked gluten-free spaghetti with the tofu and broccoli and serve.

Hopefully, these recipe ideas spark some inspiration for new gluten-free pasta dishes you can try at home!
